00055 /**
00056  * Factory class for making chip streams based on a string representation. 
00057  */
00058 class QuantMethodFactory {
00059 
00060 public:
00061   
00062   enum QuantType { Expression, GenoType };
00063 
00064   /** 
00065    * @brief Constructor. Registers the objects we know how to create and how
00066    * they describe themselves.
00067    */    
00068   QuantMethodFactory();
00069     
00070   /** 
00071    * @brief Constructor. Registers the objects we know how to create and how
00072    * they describe themselves.
00073    * @param Type of Quantification methods to make available.
00074    */    
00075   QuantMethodFactory(enum QuantType type);
00076 
00077   virtual ~QuantMethodFactory();
00078   
00079   void registerMethod(SelfDoc &doc, SelfCreate::selfCreator maker) {
00080     m_Docs.push_back(doc);
00081     m_Creators.push_back(maker);
00082   }
00083 
00084   /** 
00085    * @brief Create a pointer to a new QuantMethod object as described
00086    * in the string specification.
00087    * @param spec - Specification string i.e. quant-norm.sketch=1000000
00088    * 
00089    * @return Pointer to new QuantMethod objects, must be deleted when
00090    * finished.
00091    */
00092   QuantMethod *qMethodForString(const std::string &spec);
00093 
00094   /** 
00095    * @brief Create a pointer to a new QuantMethod object as described
00096    * in the string specification.
00097    * @param spec - Specification string i.e. quant-norm.sketch=1000000
00098    * @param board - Blackboard with various state
00099    * @return Pointer to new QuantMethod objects, must be deleted when
00100    * finished.
00101    */
00102   QuantMethod *quantMethodForString(const string &spec, PsBoard &board, QuantType type);
00103 
00104   /** 
00105    * @brief Create a pointer to a new QuantMethod object as described
00106    * in the string specification.
00107    * @param spec - Specification string i.e. quant-norm.sketch=1000000
00108    * @param board - Blackboard with various state
00109    * @return Pointer to new QuantMethod objects, must be deleted when
00110    * finished.
00111    */
00112   QuantMethod *quantMethodForString(const string &spec, PsBoard &board);
00113 
00114 
00115   /** 
00116    * @brief Factory for creating QuantMethod from string representation.
00117    * 
00118    * @param spec - Name of QuantMethod.
00119    * @param layout - Probe and probe set info.
00120    * 
00121    * @return Quantification method requested.
00122    */
00123   QuantMethod *quantMethodForString(string &spec, ChipLayout &layout, QuantType type);
00124 
00125   /** 
00126    * @brief Factory for creating QuantMethod from string representation.
00127    * 
00128    * @param spec - Name of QuantMethod.
00129    * @param layout - Probe and probe set info.
00130    * 
00131    * @return Quantification method requested.
00132    */
00133   QuantExprMethod *quantExprMethodForString(string &spec, ChipLayout &layout, QuantType type);
00134 
00135   /** 
00136    * @brief Factory for creating genotyping QuantMethod from string
00137    * representation.
00138    * 
00139    * @param spec - Name of QuantMethod.
00140    * @param layout - Probe and probe set info.
00141    * 
00142    * @return Quantification method requested.
00143    */
00144   QuantGTypeMethod *quantGTypeMethodForString(string &spec, ChipLayout &layout, QuantType type);
00145 
00146   /** 
00147    * Set the probes to be used as gc background for quantification methods.
00148    * Note that memory for the probes is owned elsewhere.
00149    *
00150    * @param gcControlProbes - Probes that should be used for
00151    * background distribution.
00152    */
00153   void setGcControlProbes(const std::vector<Probe *> &gcControlProbes) {
00154     m_GcControlProbes = gcControlProbes;
00155   }
00156 
00157   /** 
00158    * Open a file and read the precomputed probe effects to use in plier
00159    * from it.
00160    * 
00161    * @param fileName - Path to file containing probe effects.
00162    * @param effects - Map of probe ids to probe effects to be filled in.
00163    */
00164 
00165   static int openPrecompFeatureEffects(       const std::string& fileName, 
00166                                               double* effects, 
00167                                               const ChipLayout &layout);
00168 
00169   int openPrecompFeatureEffects_A5(affx::File5_Group* group5,
00170                                            const std::string& name, 
00171                                            double* effects,
00172                                            const ChipLayout &layout);
00173 
00174   /** 
00175    * Read the feature responses from a file. File should have columns
00176    * for 'probeset_id', 'probe_id' and 'feature_response'.
00177    * 
00178    * @param fileName - text file with feature responses.
00179    */
00180   const void readPrecompFeatureEffectsFromFile( int iProbeCount, 
00181                                                 const std::string& fileName, 
00182                                                 const ChipLayout &layout);
00183 
00184   void readPrecompFeatureEffectsFrom_A5(      int iProbeCount, 
00185                                               affx::File5_Group* group5,
00186                                               const std::string& name, 
00187                                               const ChipLayout &layout); 
00188 
00189 
00190 
00191   /**
00192    * Get the vector of documentation objects that this factory is aware of.
00193    * @return - vector of documentation objects.
00194    */
00195   std::vector<SelfDoc> getDocs() {
00196     return m_Docs;
00197   }
00198 
00199   void static setupQuantMethodFactory(
00200         QuantMethodFactory &qFactory,
00201         affx::File5_File * inputFile,
00202         affx::File5_Group * inputGroup,
00203         affx::File5_File * outputFile,
00204         affx::File5_Group * outputGroup,
00205         uint32_t probeCount,
00206         const std::string &outDir,
00207         const std::string &useFeatEff,
00208         bool a5FeatureEffectsInputGlobal,
00209         const std::string &a5FeatureEffectsInputFile,
00210         const std::string &a5FeatureEffectsInputName,
00211         const std::string &a5FeatureEffectsInputGroup,
00212         const std::string &a5InputGroup,
00213         const std::string &a5Group,
00214         const std::string &setAnalysisName,
00215         const std::string &quantMethodSpec,
00216         const ChipLayout &layout 
00217      );
00218 
00219 
00220   /** 
00221    * Can this factory be used to build from this specification?
00222    * @param spec - Specification in form "chipstream.key=value.key=value"
00223    * @return true if this factory knows how to build from this specification, false otherwise
00224    */
00225   bool canBuild(const std::string &spec) {
00226     return SelfCreate::canMake(spec, m_Docs);
00227   }
00228   
00229 
00230 private:
00231 
00232   void demangleName(  const std::string inputString,
00233                       std::string &demangledProbeSetName,
00234                       int &allele_id,
00235                       int &context_id);
00236 
00237 protected:
00238 
00239   // Feature effects of all probes. All data in feature effects file.
00240   double* m_PrecompFeatureEffects; 
00241   int m_iFeatureEffectSize;
00242   /// Background probes to use. Note that the memory is owned elsewhere.
00243   std::vector<Probe *> m_GcControlProbes;    
00244   /// Self documentation
00245   std::vector<SelfDoc> m_Docs;
00246   /// Self creation
00247   std::vector<SelfCreate::selfCreator> m_Creators;
00248 };
